sentences.english: Thou annointest my day with pep; my mug runneth over.
sentences.chinese: 你宣告了我充沛的一天，一切的疲惫必然消失不见。

sentences.english: They don't want to arrive home to a needy mother, she says.
sentences.chinese: 他们不希望回到家来又看到妈妈穷困疲惫。

sentences.english: Don't exhaust yourself or minor health problems will set in.
sentences.chinese: 不要让自己太疲惫，否则健康问题会乘虚而入的。

sentences.english: Have certain effect to counteractive exhaustion and negative sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 对反抗疲惫与消极情绪有一定的作用。

sentences.english: As the night wears on, exhaustion overcomes their discomfort.
sentences.chinese: 随着夜色深沉，疲惫最终战胜了她们的不适。

sentences.english: The neighbor with a look of haggardness and tiredness opened the door.
sentences.chinese: 一脸憔悴和疲惫的邻居开了门。

sentences.english: The tired children don't get home until 7:00.
sentences.chinese: 疲惫不堪的孩子们要道晚上7点才能到家。

sentences.english: When she last saw him, he was a sad ─old and tired.
sentences.chinese: 她上次见到他时，他一副惨兮兮的样子苍老而疲惫。

sentences.english: Seán's arms became very tired from fanning away the flies.
sentences.chinese: 肖恩的武器变得非常疲惫由范宁把苍蝇。

sentences.english: After a 30-minute wait, a frazzled receptionist showed up.
sentences.chinese: 经过30分钟的等待，一个疲惫不堪的接待员出现了。

sentences.english: Sometimes I'm tired and miserable for no reason at all.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，我就是没来由地觉得疲惫和痛苦。

sentences.english: Stagnation and fatigue are other factors that can negatively affect concentration.
sentences.chinese: 停滞和疲惫是影响你专注力的另外的因素。

sentences.english: Zhang is prepared for exhausting military exercises.
sentences.chinese: 张阳已经准备好迎接疲惫的军事训练了。

sentences.english: The quiet contentment of a well-fed child satisfied the tired mother.
sentences.chinese: 孩子喂饱后不哭不闹的满足状使疲惫的母亲很满意。

sentences.english: He was 3 very tired but just as 4 he went to bed, the telephone rang.
sentences.chinese: 他非常疲惫，但就在他刚躺下时电话铃响了。

sentences.english: All that dancing really did her in.
sentences.chinese: 那一场舞跳下来真使她疲惫不堪。

definition: spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
wan and sallow/thin and pallid/haggard/(of plants) withered
